results.content:
The most awful course I've ever seen.
I've seen *nothing* about the performance of react-apps here.
On the one side, there are "amazing" advises like
'Don't write
const a = 1;
const b = 2;
because
const a = 1, b = 2; has better performance.' Really?! Can you prove it?? 
On the other side... The main part of this "course" is just reading the official documentation. The most general and helpless ideas.
Author, could you explain why you don't use create-react-app and spent a few hours our my time to show me your version? Is it better? Prove it. As I see it worse and you just steal my time.
As a result: the title is just a trick and trying to cheat you, be careful.

results.content:
Part 1 and 2, were incredibly good...

Part 3, no resources and without a way to follow up what he is explaining...being just listening is easy to fall asleep. Its good when there is a small introduction about the project setup or a repository with that project.

EDIT: I don't ask for a refund because part 1 and 2 are really useful!

results.content:
So far there are no updates to the recent versions. So any updates by node is shown in the comments or the tutorial videos. You will run into errors.

UPDATE -- So I have been taking this course for a month now (on and off). I have had some questions regarding the outdated instructions of this course. I emailed the instructor, and they really never got back to me. By the time that they did, I had already found the answer online to the question I had. At this point, this tutorial - if that's what you want to call it - is not worth the money they are asking. Don't waste your time.

results.content: So far, it makes no sense. There's nothing really related to performance.

results.content: The Redux section of this course feels rushed and impersonal. The incessant pace and lack of elaboration left me feeling unclear and ill-equipped.
